snippet: The last time that the Danish-Icelandic artist Olafur Eliasson worked at the Tate Modern, he set a giant fake sun shining over the museum's massive Turbine Hall, in a project that drew more than two million visitors; on Thursday at the museum, he...
abstract: The last time that the Danish-Icelandic artist Olafur Eliasson worked at the Tate Modern, he set a giant fake sun shining over the museum's massive Turbine Hall, in a project that drew more than two million visitors; on Thursday at the museum, he introduced "Little Sun," a project involving solar-powered lamps meant to help people in developing countries.

headline.main: Olafur Eliasson Brings Sunlight Back to Tate Modern
